reason: Species is rat and in vivo single-unit electrophysiology is present.

header.title: Single-neuron population coupling across sensory and (para)hippocampal areas in freely moving rats
header.authors: Reinder Dorman, Jochem S. Montijn, Christian M.A. Pennartz, Cyriel M.A. Pennartz

data_description.brain_region: hippocampal CA1, somatosensory cortex (S1BF), visual cortex (V1), perirhinal cortex (PER)
data_description.behavioral_condition: freely moving, active wakefulness, quiet wakefulness, non-REM sleep

spike_level.unit_inclusion_thresholds: Significantly coupled cells defined as SNPC above 4.5 standard deviations from shuffled distribution
spike_level.computed_metrics: Single-neuron population coupling (SNPC), Z-scored to shuffled distribution, cross-correlation of single unit with population activity
spike_level.stat_controls: Spearman’s rank correlation, Pearson’s correlation, Kruskal–Wallis test, Wilcoxon’s signed-rank and rank sum tests, Bonferroni correction, bootstrapping (1,000 iterations)

spatial_level.spatial_metrics: Spatial selectivity, correlation of SNPC with spatial coding

population_level.correlation_measures: Spearman’s rank correlation, Pearson’s correlation between within- and between-area coupling
population_level.dimensionality_reduction: Not specified (multi-Gaussian curve fitting and dimensionality reduction mentioned but not systematically used)
population_level.decoding_prediction: Decoding accuracy of cell’s activity from local and external population activity
population_level.synchrony_assembly: Broadcasting index (number of areas a single cell is significantly coupled with)

temporal_network.cross_correlation: Cross-correlation of single unit activity with summed population activity within and between areas
